data.title: Icarus (1989)
data.meta_description: This is indeed the story of Icarus, son of Dedalus, trapped in a labyrinth, but with a variation.
data.text:
This was a short episode of a tv series Ocelot had back in the late '80's called Ciné si. Unfortunately, it only ran eight episodes. After Ocelot's success with Kirikou and the Sorceress, six of the eight episodes were edited into the movie Princes and Princesses. Sadly, Icarus was left out. As I said in my review for Princes and Princesses, I love the wraparound story of a teacher and students in a theater watching these stories together. Little did I know that was the conceit for Ciné si.

Anyways,Icarus is more of the same from Ocelot. Mythology/Fairy Tale based silhouette animation with some tongue-in-cheek humor. The animation is great, and I'm always a sucker for Greek mythology. Love the…
